verses.verse: Manasseh <WH4519> was twelve<WH8147> <WH6240> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when he began to reign,<WH4427> and he reigned<WH4427> fifty<WH2572> and five<WH2568> years<WH8141> in Jerusalem: <WH3389>

But did<WH6213> that which was evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the LORD,<WH3068> like unto the abominations<WH8441> of the heathen,<WH1471> whom<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> had cast out<WH3423> before<WH4480> <WH6440> the children<WH1121> of Israel.<WH3478>

For he built<WH1129> again<WH7725> <WH853> the high places<WH1116> which<WH834> Hezekiah<WH3169> his father<WH1> had broken down,<WH5422> and he reared up<WH6965> altars<WH4196> for Baalim,<WH1168> and made<WH6213> groves,<WH842> and worshiped<WH7812> all<WH3605> the host<WH6635> of heaven,<WH8064> and served<WH5647> them.
Also he built<WH1129> altars<WH4196> in the house<WH1004> of the LORD,<WH3068> whereof<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> had said,<WH559> In Jerusalem<WH3389> shall my name<WH8034> be<WH1961> forever.<WH5769>
And he built<WH1129> altars<WH4196> for all<WH3605> the host<WH6635> of heaven<WH8064> in the two<WH8147> courts<WH2691> of the house<WH1004> of the LORD.<WH3068>

And he<WH1931> caused<WH853> his children<WH1121> to pass<WH5674> through the fire<WH784> in the valley<WH1516> of the son<WH1121> of Hinnom:<WH2011> also he observed times,<WH6049> and used enchantments,<WH5172> and used witchcraft,<WH3784> and dealt with<WH6213> a familiar spirit,<WH178> and with wizards:<WH3049> he wrought<WH6213> much<WH7235> evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the LORD,<WH3068> to provoke him to anger.<WH3707>

And he set<WH7760> <WH853> a carved image,<WH6459> the idol<WH5566> which<WH834> he had made,<WH6213> in the house<WH1004> of God,<WH430> of which<WH834> God<WH430> had said<WH559> to<WH413> David<WH1732> and to<WH413> Solomon<WH8010> his son,<WH1121> In this<WH2088> house,<WH1004> and in Jerusalem,<WH3389> which<WH834> I have chosen<WH977> before all<WH4480> <WH3605> the tribes<WH7626> of Israel,<WH3478> will I put<WH7760> <WH853> my name<WH8034> forever: <WH5865>

Neither <WH3808> will I any more<WH3254> remove<WH5493> <WH853> the foot<WH7272> of Israel<WH3478> from out of<WH4480> <WH5921> the land<WH127> which<WH834> I have appointed<WH5975> for your fathers;<WH1> so that<WH7535> <WH518> they will take heed<WH8104> to do<WH6213> <WH853> all<WH3605> that<WH834> I have commanded<WH6680> them, according to the whole<WH3605> law<WH8451> and the statutes<WH2706> and the ordinances<WH4941> by the hand<WH3027> of Moses.<WH4872>

So Manasseh<WH4519> made<WH853> Judah<WH3063> and the inhabitants<WH3427> of Jerusalem<WH3389> to err,<WH8582> and to do<WH6213> worse<WH7451> than<WH4480> the heathen,<WH1471> whom<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> had destroyed<WH8045> before<WH4480> <WH6440> the children<WH1121> of Israel.<WH3478>
And the LORD<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> to<WH413> Manasseh,<WH4519> and to<WH413> his people:<WH5971> but they would not<WH3808> hearken.<WH7181>

Wherefore the LORD<WH3068> brought<WH935> upon<WH5921> <WH853> them the captains<WH8269> of the host of<WH6635> the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> which<WH834> took<WH3920> <WH853> Manasseh<WH4519> among the thorns,<WH2336> and bound<WH631> him with fetters,<WH5178> and carried<WH1980> him to Babylon.<WH894>

And when he was in affliction,<WH6887> he besought<WH2470> <WH853> the LORD<WH6440> <WH3068> his God,<WH430> and humbled himself<WH3665> greatly<WH3966> before<WH4480> <WH6440> the God<WH430> of his fathers,<WH1>

And prayed<WH6419> unto<WH413> him: and he was entreated<WH6279> of him, and heard<WH8085> his supplication,<WH8467> and brought him again<WH7725> to Jerusalem<WH3389> into his kingdom.<WH4438> Then Manasseh<WH4519> knew<WH3045> that<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> he<WH1931> was God.<WH430>

Now after<WH310> this<WH3651> he built<WH1129> a wall<WH2346> without<WH2435> the city<WH5892> of David,<WH1732> on the west side<WH4628> of Gihon,<WH1521> in the valley,<WH5158> even to the entering in<WH935> at the fish<WH1709> gate<WH8179> and compassed about<WH5437> Ophel,<WH6077> and raised it up a very great height,<WH1361> <WH3966> and put<WH7760> captains<WH8269> of war<WH2428> in all<WH3605> the fenced<WH1219> cities<WH5892> of Judah.<WH3063>

And he took away<WH5493> <WH853> the strange<WH5236> gods,<WH430> and the idol<WH5566> out of the house<WH4480> <WH1004> of the LORD,<WH3068> and all<WH3605> the altars<WH4196> that<WH834> he had built<WH1129> in the mount<WH2022> of the house<WH1004> of the LORD,<WH3068> and in Jerusalem,<WH3389> and cast<WH7993> them out of<WH2351> the city.<WH5892>

And he repaired<WH1129> <WH853> the altar<WH4196> of the LORD,<WH3068> and sacrificed<WH2076> thereon<WH5921> peace<WH8002> offerings<WH2077> and thank offerings,<WH8426> and commanded<WH559> Judah<WH3063> to serve<WH5647> <WH853> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel.<WH3478>
Nevertheless <WH61> the people<WH5971> did sacrifice<WH2076> still<WH5750> in the high places,<WH1116> yet unto the LORD<WH3068> their God<WH430> only.<WH7535>

Now the rest<WH3499> of the acts of<WH1697> Manasseh,<WH4519> and his prayer<WH8605> unto<WH413> his God,<WH430> and the words<WH1697> of the seers<WH2374> that spoke<WH1696> to<WH413> him in the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> behold,<WH2009> they are written in<WH5921> the book<WH1697> of the kings<WH4428> of Israel.<WH3478>

His prayer<WH8605> also, and how God was entreated<WH6279> of him, and all<WH3605> his sin,<WH2403> and his trespass,<WH4604> and the places<WH4725> wherein<WH834> he built<WH1129> high places,<WH1116> and set up<WH5975> groves<WH842> and graven images,<WH6456> before<WH6440> he was humbled:<WH3665> behold,<WH2009> they are written<WH3789> among<WH5921> the sayings<WH1697> of the seers.<WH2335>
So Manasseh<WH4519> slept<WH7901> with<WH5973> his fathers,<WH1> and they buried<WH6912> him in his own house:<WH1004> and Amon<WH526> his son<WH1121> reigned<WH4427> in his stead.<WH8478>
Amon <WH526> was two<WH8147> and twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when he began to reign,<WH4427> and reigned<WH4427> two<WH8147> years<WH8141> in Jerusalem.<WH3389>

But he did<WH6213> that which was evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the LORD,<WH3068> as<WH834> did<WH6213> Manasseh<WH4519> his father:<WH1> for Amon<WH526> sacrificed<WH2076> unto all<WH3605> the carved images<WH6456> which<WH834> Manasseh<WH4519> his father<WH1> had made,<WH6213> and served<WH5647> them;

And humbled not himself<WH3808> <WH3665> before<WH4480> <WH6440> the LORD,<WH3068> as Manasseh<WH4519> his father<WH1> had humbled himself;<WH3665> but<WH3588> Amon<WH526> trespassed<WH819> more and more.<WH7235>
And his servants<WH5650> conspired<WH7194> against<WH5921> him, and slew<WH4191> him in his own house.<WH1004>

But the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776> slew<WH5221> <WH853> all<WH3605> them that had conspired<WH7194> against<WH5921> king<WH4428> Amon;<WH526> and the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776> made Josiah his son king<WH4427> <WH853> <WH2977> <WH1121> in his stead.<WH8478>
